alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:47AM EST until February 18 at 12:49PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Baxter affecting Harlan County. Cumberland River at Pineville affecting Bell County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Pineville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 1005.0 feet, KY Route 66 north of Straight Creek bridge floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 993.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and reach a crest near 1005.0 feet just after midnight early Saturday morning. The river should then fall below flood stage on Saturday. - Flood stage is 1002.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1005.0 feet on 01/04/1982. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
